comment._content: Lieutenant Arthur Hewitt Allen, MC 1st Bn, North Staffordshire Regiment, attached 72nd Coy, Machine Gun Corps (MCG) More information at: www.wartimememoriesproject.com/greatwar/allied/view.php?u... Information from the London Gazette: Commissioned Second Lieutenant: 23 July 1915 (London Gazette, 4 August, p. 7657): www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29250/supplements/7657/ Military Cross (apparently for an action at Messines Ridge, but no date is given); award announced in the London Gazette, 26 September 1917, p. 9972: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30308/supplements/9972/ Also in the Edinburgh Gazette, 27 September 1917, p. 2052: www.edinburgh-gazette.co.uk/issues/13146/pages/2052/ Citation (London Gazette, 9 January 1918, pp. 582-583): T./Lt. Arthur Hewitt Allen, N. Staff R., attd. M.G. Corps. For conspicuous gallantry and devotion in leading his company in an attack. He directed an attack on an enemy machine gun , which was holding up our advance, captured the gun and killed or captured the crew. Afterwards believing himself to be the only officer surviving in the attacking companies, he directed their fire on enemy machine guns and snipers, moving from shell hole to shell hole with utter disregard of his own personal danger to satisfy himself that the line was being properly maintained. Later, he was knocked down and severely bruised by a shell, but refused to leave his company and directed the carrying of rations to the front line. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30466/supplements/582/ Also published in the Edinburgh Gazette, 10 January 1918, pp. 242-243: www.edinburgh-gazette.co.uk/issues/13192/pages/242/ Leaves the MGC (London Gazette, 5 December 1917, p. 12759): Lt. A. H. Allen, M.C..(N. Staff. R.) ceases to belong to the Corps on rejoining his regular unit. 26 Nov. 1917. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/30414/supplements/12759/ Relinquishes commission, retains the rank of Lt., 11 October 1921 (London Gazette, 11 October 1921, p. 8040): www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/32484/supplements/8040/

comment._content: Arthur Hewitt Allen birth recorded 2nd qr 1892 in Basford Arthur H Allen marriage recorded to Ida Steventon 4th qr 1918 in Basford (One of many Arthur H Allen marriages, but the year and Basford location would make this the likely fit.) Ida Steventon birth recorded 2nd qr 1893 in Nottingham Allen / Steventon offspring: Phyllis Allen birth recorded 3rd qr 1918 in Chesterfield Ronald Allen birth recorded 2nd qr 1922 in Chesterfield www.freebmd.co.uk
